headline: UPS Union Lawsuit And Temu Dispute Test Labor And Contract Story
summary: The Teamsters union has filed an emergency lawsuit and injunction against United Parcel Service over its new Driver Choice Program, alleging violations of the national labor contract. The program reportedly requires drivers to permanently leave UPS and give up union rights in exchange for buyout payments. Separately, a UPS Irish subsidiary has reportedly canceled shipping accounts tied to Temu's parent company over unpaid shipment fees. For investors watching NYSE:UPS, this mix of labor and...
